Name: N'Djamena
Description: N'Djamena is the capital of Chad. It is by far the country's largest city, with a population of 1 million people. It lies directly on the border of Cameroon, and is located on the confluence of the Chari and Logone rivers. The city has been at the centre of many heated rebellions and revolts, and in February 2008 was entered by rebel troops.

Name: Moundou
Description: Moundou is a city in the Soudanian region of Chad.

Name: Abéché
Description: Abeche is the capital of Ouaddai Province in Chad. It was once the capital of the Wadai Empire.

Name: Faya
Description: Faya, also known as Faya-Largeau a city in Saharan Chad.
